actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

official_title: To amend title XXI of the Social Security Act to require 12-month continuous coverage under the State Children's Health Insurance Program.
short_title: Ensuring Continuous Coverage under SCHIP Act of 2011

summary.text: Ensuring Continuous Coverage under SCHIP Act of 2011 - Amends title XXI (Children's Health Insurance) (CHIP, formerly known as SCHIP) of the Social Security Act (SSA) with respect to a state plan that provides child health insurance through a means other than through the state's plan under SSA title XIX (Medicaid). Requires in such a case for the CHIP plan to implement the 12-month continuous eligibility option available under Medicaid for targeted low-income children whose family income is below 200% of the poverty line.

titles.title: Ensuring Continuous Coverage under SCHIP Act of 2011
To amend title XXI of the Social Security Act to require 12-month continuous coverage under the State Children's Health Insurance Program.
